articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Fighting in the city of Rafah, where Israel is targeting the remaining brigades of the militant Islamist Hamas movement, would continue, the military said.
articles.title: Israeli military announces tactical pauses in Gaza for aid supplies

articles.author: Thomas Escritt, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: Western powers and countries from the rest of the world will use the second day of a major summit in Switzerland on Sunday to pursue a consensus on condemning Russia's invasion of Ukraine and underscoring concerns about the war's human cost.
articles.title: Ukraine summit strives for broad consensus to lean on Russia to end war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Six detainees, some with links to Islamic State, took guards hostage at a pre-trial detention centre in Russia's southern region of Rostov and demanded free passage in negotiations with the authorities, Russian media reported on Sunday.
articles.title: Prisoners with ISIS links take guards hostage in Russian detention centre, media report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German police fired shots at a person who threatened officers with a pickaxe and an incendiary device on the sidelines of a soccer fan parade in the St Pauli district of central Hamburg on Sunday, according to a police post on social media platform X.
articles.title: German police fire shots at axe-wielding person at Hamburg soccer fan parade

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Fourteen Jordanians have been reported dead during the annual Muslim haj pilgrimage in Saudi Arabia, some of them due to heat stroke, while 17 others were reported missing, the Jordanian foreign ministry said in a statement on Sunday.
articles.title: Fourteen Jordanians die during haj in Saudi Arabia, some succumb to heat

articles.author: Ben Blanchard, Ann Wang
articles.description: China views the annexation and "elimination" of Taiwan as its great national cause, Taiwan President Lai Ching-te said on Sunday, telling cadets at the military's premier academy they must know their enemy and not give in to defeatism.
articles.title: China views Taiwan's 'elimination' as national cause, Taiwan president says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Swedish citizen Johan Floderus said he was in seventh heaven following his release from an Iranian prison on Saturday, in a recording published on the Swedish government's website on Sunday.
articles.title: Swedish diplomat in 'seventh heaven' following release from Iran

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australian writer Yang Hengjun's suspended death sentence has been upheld by Beijing's High People's Court, with the decision relayed to Australian officials two weeks before China's Premier Li Qiang arrived in Australia, his supporters said on Sunday.
articles.title: Australian writer's sentence upheld ahead of China Premier's visit, say supporters

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Africa's uMkhonto we Sizwe (MK) party will join an alliance of smaller opposition parties in parliament in a bid to take on the African National Congress and Democratic Alliance-led coalition government, it said on Sunday.
articles.title: Ex-leader Zuma's party says it will join opposition in South Africa's parliament

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Al Qaeda affiliate Jama'a Nusrat ul-Islam wa al-Muslimin (JNIM) group has claimed responsibility for an attack on June 11 that killed over 100 Burkina Faso soldiers in Mansila area near the border with Niger, the SITE Intelligence Group said on Sunday.
articles.title: Al Qaeda affiliate claims responsibility for Burkina attack that killed over 100, SITE Intelligence Group says
